block.comment: Each move in the game history alternates between 1 (win) and -1 (loss).

custom-block.s: Send %txt data input %l output %l %br ignore old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

custom-block.comment: If the first player is a trained model do more training with the results of this game.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.comment: This script should really be improved in the case of two models playing each other. If the model is playing itself it shouldn't train twice. And if two different models are playing it is better if the second one starts when the first one finishes.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.comment: The history of this game is sent as training data.

custom-block.s: one hot %n out of %n possible values

block.comment: Fill the square with an X or an O.
Record the updated board in the game's history.

custom-block.comment: Figure out who won or if it is a tie or if the game isn't over.
Among other things this will retrain any players that are models.

block.comment: Start a new game automatically if both players are computers.

block-definition.comment: Picks randomly among all the possible moves.

custom-block.s: remove say balloon or think bubble
remove say balloon or think bubble

block.comment: If first move is not a human player then computer should make a move.

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

block-definition.s: one hot %'value' out of %'n' possible values

custom-block.comment: Makes a list of winning predictions (negative predictions are for losses).
By dividing each prediction we ensure the sum of all probabilities adds up to one.
Browser's console log keeps a record of moves by trained models.

block.comment: If trained models predicts all moves will lose pick the least bad one.

custom-block.s: Get predictions from model %txt with inputs %l %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Asks the model to get predictions of each of the possible next board positions. Higher predictions are treated as higher probability moves.

block-definition.s: remove say balloon or think bubble
Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl ignore old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Distance Compute Weighted Loss Cosine Distance Hinge Loss Huber Loss Log Loss Mean Squared Error Sigmoid Cross Entropy Softmax Cross Entropy

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Get predictions from model %'name' with inputs %'inputs' $nl then %'process predictions' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to make predictions for each value in 'inputs'
Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.
Make previously opened selected support panel visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.comment: 'message' will be printed on the browser's console.
